titlestmt.subtitle: Finding Aid
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Grace Ramsay.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded in NoteTab Pro. Encoded by Jeanne Lowrey. 2013-12-09

did.head: Collection Overview
did.abstract: Contains personal correspondence, mostly from Isabel Lindsay to her family during her years at Smith College.

bioghist.p: Isabel Gray Lindsay was born on February 4, 1886, in Milwaukee, WI. Before Smith, she attended Milwaukee-Downer Seminary for preparatory school. Lindsay attended Smith College from 1903 to 1907. She lived in Haven House, 112 Elm Street, and 30 Green Street. She was active in extracurricular activities in her senior year: Lindsay was President of the Phi Kappa Psi Honor Society, a senior member of La Societe Francais, Chair of the Religious Service Committee and Chair of Students' Exchange in the Smith College Association for Catholic Women, a Junior Usher, an honorary member of the Biological Society, a senior member of A.O.H March, and a senior member of "G.O.O.". After graduating Smith, Lindsay married Henry Frederic Helmholz and moved to Rochester, Minnesota. She had three children: Lindsay, who later attended Cornell University, Henry F. Jr., an alum of Dartmouth College, and Margaret, Class of 1939. Lindsay passed away on November 29, 1975.

scopecontent.p: The collection mostly contains outgoing correspondence from Isabel Lindsay from 1903-1907, but there are some letters from her father, George Ingles Lindsay. There are also two essays she wrote for an Ethics class and a Religion class at Smith. The folders correspond with the academic semester in which Lindsay sent her letters.

accessrestrict.p: The records are open for research according to the regulations of the Smith College Archives except where noted in the finding aid.

userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. Permission to publish material from the documents must be requested from the Smith College Archives. Smith College owns copyright to any published material relating to college events and activities. Provenance and copyright ownership of other materials is unknown and researchers are responsible for determining any question of copyright.

prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
Isabel Lindsay Papers, Box #, Smith College Archives.

acqinfo.p: The Isabel Lindsay papers were donated over a period of time to the Smith College Archives from a variety of sources.
